level.text: An unincorporated nonprofit association may acquire, hold, encumber, or transfer in its name an interest in property.
An unincorporated nonprofit association may be a beneficiary of a trust or contract, a legatee, or a devisee.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: The 2013 amendment by D.C. Law 19-210 deleted "real or personal" preceding "property" in (a).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 18-378
level.text: For history of Law 18-378, see notes under ยง 29-101.01.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 19-210
level.text: Law 19-210, the "'District of Columbia Official Code Title 29 Technical and Harmonizing Amendments Act of 2012," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 19-532. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on July 10, 2012, and Oct. 2, 2012, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on Oct. 31, 2012, it was assigned Act No. 19-512 and transmitted to Congress for its review. D.C. Law 19-210 became effective on Mar. 5, 2013.

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Uniform Law: This section is based on ยง 6 of the Uniform Unincorporated Nonprofit Association Act (2008 Act).
Application of Law 19-210: Section 7 of D.C. Law 19-210 provided that the act shall apply as of January 1, 2012.
